ExampleDefinition.Title: Candlestick and Lines
ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates how to simple multi-series financial charts, with a Candlestick chart rendering OHLC data and three line series rendering Moving Average indicators
ExampleDefinition.Description: <Run FontSize="14" FontWeight="Bold">Candlestick and Lines</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13">Generates a Candlestick Chart with three Line-Series showing the moving average of the closing price.</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontWeight="Bold" FontStyle="Italic">Interactivity Options</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic"> - ZoomPan, left-mouse drag to pan the chart</Run> <LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic"> - Mousewheel, roll the mousewheel to zoom</Run> <LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic"> - ZoomExtents, double click to zoom to extents</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontWeight="Bold" FontStyle="Italic">Tip!</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic">To get the effect of hiding the line for the first N points of a moving average, you can insert double.NaN into the XyDataSeries. </Run> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic">double.NaN can be used to render gaps or continuous lines.</Run>
